data.text:
Introduction

There is no question about how popular Korean dramas are. The question is why they are at the top in the digital entertainment world. Well, there are several reasons behind the phenomenal success of Korean content:

Appealing good looks of the casts

Stylish fashion sense

Surprising twist in every plot

Funny flair of humor

Short & compact episodes

Addictive cinematography

So, to enjoy the epitome of entertainment, Korean dramas, movies, or shows anytime on any device, you can try the top 10 free & paid Kdrama websites with the smart option to download streaming video from these sites to save and watch Korean drama permanently for your lifetime enjoyment.

Top the 10 Free & Paid Kdrama Websites

If you are geo-restricted from accessing your favorite Korean drama or can't spend money on paid subscriptions, you can enjoy them on some authentic and exclusive free Kdrama websites. Here you go with the list of the top 10 free Kdrama websites.

1. Kocowa

For audiences in North, Central, South America, Canada, & Brazil, Kocowa is the ultimate platform to enjoy blockbuster Korean drama. This is one of the most popular, safe, legal, and authentic free Kdrama websites that offers Google & Facebook synchronization.

Pros:

Subtitles support in multiple languages: English, Spanish & Portuguese

17000 hours of news & classic content from Asian Country

All the Korean shows are available within 6 hours of their original broadcast.

Con:

Limited access to certain locations

2. Viki

To talk about the free Kdrama website, Viki by Rakuten is the most fascinating platform to explore exclusive Korean content online. The best part of this platform is that it offers an official app available for mobile or TV platform.

Pros:

It is available in a maximum number of countries & region

"Watch Party" option for real-time group streaming

Multiple language subtitles support

Con:

Excessive ads annoyance

3. Netflix

Netflix is a platform for Korean dramas developed for a global audience, however, the available Korean drama content may vary depending on your region. Netflix has produced a series of original Korean drama works such as Kingdom, Love Alarm, Extracurricular, Sweet Home, Queen Tears, etc., all of which are exclusive to Netflix.

It also holds exclusive streaming licenses for some TV shows broadcast on South Korean television stations, as well as a selection of variety shows and movies.

Pros:

Available for global k-drama audiences

Exclusive original K-drama shows and movies

Multiple language subtitles support

Con:

Subscription is required

4. Asian Crush

Asian crush is available in the United States and Canada regions. The majority of the Korean dramas on the platform are web series, but the content of Korean films is quite rich. You can either subscribe for a fee or use the platform for free to watch Korean dramas.

Pros:

Offer free & paid options for you to watch Kdramas

Have a wide range choice of asian shows, not just limited to kdrma

Con:

Only US & Canada users can access the service

5. Amazon Prime

One of the most commendable aspects of Amazon is the plethora of channels it offers for subscription, such as Kocowa. The range of Korean drama content it covers is remarkably extensive. However, the content provided by these channels may vary depending on your location. In my personal opinion, subscribing to Korean drama channels on Amazon is a very convenient way of watching.

Pros:

Offer a lot of Kdrama channels

Can be accessed worldwide

Con:

Like Netflix, subscription is required to watch k-dramas on Prime video

6. OnDemandKorea

OnDemandKorea offers complimentary, ad-supported streaming and on-demand television programs, Korean pop music, movies, and original content. In comparison to other Korean streaming services, Ondemandkorea stands out with its vast content library and affordable subscription plans.

For those seeking to indulge in Korean entertainment without breaking the bank, this is a favorable option. But the shortcoming is that most Korean dramas on Ondemandkorea lack subtitles.

Pros:

Offer both free and paid options to watch k-drama

ODK boasts a wealth of content collections, encompassing news programs, films, and daily dramas

Con:

No subtitles for most korean dramas

7. YouTube

Apart from the usual entertainment and viral videos, YouTube can also be a platform to watch Korean dramas. Some major Korean media outlets, such as KBS World, have official accounts on YouTube where they release some of their dramas for users to watch for free. The quality can reach up to 1080P, and YouTube also has the capability to automatically generate subtitles.

Pros:

Free to watch Korean dramas for global users

Auto-generated Korean subtitles and translated subtitles

The Korean drama is up to 1080P resolution

Con:

The available content is limited, not as comprehensive as Netflix & Prime video

8. iQIYI

iQIYI is a Chinese streaming media company that holds exclusive authorization for some Korean dramas. Although primarily focused on Mandarin programs, it also offers children's shows, animations, and films. Subtitles are available in multiple languages, including English and Chinese. It provides both paid and free options.

Pros:

Includes a lot of Korean and Chinese dramas & movies

You can watch Korean drama in 1080P high quality

Con:

No original Korean drama series, so the content is not so diverse

9. VIU

Viu primarily caters to users from Southeast Asia and Africa, with content possibly subject to regional restrictions. Subtitles are provided in local languages, with availability varying by region. Some content is available with Cantonese dubbing (currently only in Hong Kong).

In addition, certain regions offer localized dubbing for select content, such as Thai and Tagalog dubbing. For Viu Premium users, there will be no more video advertisements during viewing sessions.

Pros:

Offer subtitles of Korean language and the local language

Free & premium plan are available for users to choose

Con:

For free users, ads will appear when you watch Korean dramas on Viu

10. Tubi

The final website recommended is Tubi, which we have placed at the end due to its limited collection of Korean dramas, but rather extensive array of Korean films. Furthermore, its device support is relatively widespread (availability may vary by region).

Pros:

Wide support of different devices

Comprehensive selections of Korean movies

Con:

The Korean drama titles may not as many as Netflix has

FAQs

1. Where Can I Watch Korean Web-Dramas?

Korean Web-Dramas are short plays, typically initially broadcasted on the internet rather than traditional television stations. The length of the episodes is usually shorter than regular Korean dramas, typically ranging from 8 to 20 minutes.

Many online dramas revolve around themes of school, university, and romance. International viewers can often watch these dramas on Youtube, however, many streaming services also feature some of these episodes.

2. How to Determine whether the Kdrama Websites are Legal or Not?

Illicit Kdrama websites typically manifest in the form of pop-up advertisements and other forms of adult content advertising, such as pornography websites, with multiple domain addresses instead of a singular fixed URL. Additionally, there is a lack of professional customer support.
